question: What are the names of mentioned capital improvement projects?
raw_answer: Civic Center Way Improvements, Legacy Park Paver Repair Project, Tranca Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs, 2021 Annual Street Maintenance
evidence_answer: Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs, 2021 Annual Street Maintenance, Legacy Park Paver Repair Project
extracted_search_list: Tranca Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs

DISCUSSION: Staff will provide a status update on the following active projects in the

is finalizing the bid documents. (cid:190) Project Schedule:

Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff is finalizing the design of this project.

The improvements modified the existing concrete channel
underneath Civic Center Way by adding a 3’ concrete curb adjacent to the
existing flap gates.

There are two locations
within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would require a
vehicle impact protection device. Legacy Park Paver Repair Project

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule: TBD

Malibu Road Slope Repairs (CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: The existing slope adjacent to the beach access stairs
at 24712 Malibu Road has been eroded and caused damage to Malibu Road. (cid:190) Updates:

2021 Annual Street Maintenance

(cid:190) Updates: This project included resurfacing Malibu Road, Broad Beach Road,
Latigo Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, Webb Way, Rambla Pacifico
Street and Vista Pacifica with a slurry seal treatment and adding speed
humps to Birdview Avenue.

The project will also include the installation of new raised
medians on PCH in the areas where the double yellow lines exist in the vicinity
of Zuma Beach, specifically where the yellow paddles are installed.

A kick-off meeting was held in late December. (cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Completion Date: Spring 2022

Guardrail Replacement Citywide (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged

guardrail throughout the City as a result of the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:190) Updates: The contractor has completed the storm drain improvements on
Civic Center Way.

(cid:190) Project Description: This project was identified in the 2015 PCH Safety Study
and includes installing new raised medians and improvements.

Page 4 of 8

Agenda Item # 4.A. Capital Improvement Projects (Completed)

Civic Center Way Improvements

(cid:190) Updates: The contractor completed the project and Council accepted this

project as complete at the September 13th City Council Meeting. Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure

City’s Civic Center Stormwater Treatment Facility.

This project was identified in the City’s Pavement
Management Plan.

Vehicle Protection Devices

(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces located
adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area.

(cid:131) Staff reviewed proposals for engineering design services and has
selected a qualified consultant.

New raised
medians are proposed east and west of PCH and Paradise Cove Road.
